title: Why Professional Grading Is Critical Before Sod Installation
intro: Installing new sod without correcting the grade is one of the biggest mistakes homeowners make. Proper grading ensures water flows away from the house and prevents future drainage problems.
content:
What Grading Actually Does

Grading reshapes the soil surface to ensure proper water flow. Even a slight negative slope can send water toward the foundation — a major issue for older Chicago homes.

Why DIY Grading Fails

Most DIY grading efforts move soil around but do not compact or level it properly. Professional grading ensures the yard stays stable long-term.

Benefits Before Sod

• Eliminates puddling
• Prevents fungus and rot
• Helps sod root evenly
• Improves long-term lawn health

Conclusion

Grading is the foundation of a healthy lawn — literally.
